SRP.Q: What is the vertical (above/below) relationship of the area representing Stellar Bistro relative to Crimson Plate?
SRP.A: Stellar Bistro is {below} Crimson Plate in the vertical direction.

VPR.Q: Which series contributes the largest portion to the total food cost percentage?
VPR.A: The series with the largest contribution is {Sky High Cafe}.

VPR.Q: Which series contributes the smallest portion to the total food cost percentage?
VPR.A: The series with the smallest contribution is {Emerald Diner}.

VE.Q: What is Sky High Cafe's Food Cost Percentage in 1983?
VE.A: Sky High Cafe's food cost percentage in 1983 is {25.87} %.

VE.Q: What is The Golden Spoon's Food Cost Percentage in 1978?
VE.A: The Golden Spoon's food cost percentage in 1978 is {25.94} %.

VE.Q: What are the food cost percentage of Emerald Diner, Crimson Plate, and Stellar Bistro in 1964?
VE.A: Emerald Diner's food cost percentage is {21.90} %, Crimson Plate's food cost percentage is {18.65} %, Stellar Bistro's food cost percentage is {26.87} %.

EVJ.Q: What is the global minimum Food Cost Percentage in the area chart?
EVJ.A: The global minimum food cost percentage is {0.30} %.

SC.Q: What is the average total Food Cost Percentage?
SC.A: The average total food cost percentage is {99.25} %.

NC.Q: Was the total Food Cost Percentage in 1961 higher or lower than in 1985?
NC.A: The total food cost percentage in 1961 was {higher} than in 1985.

NC.Q: Was the total Food Cost Percentage in 1982 higher or lower than in 1985?
NC.A: The total food cost percentage in 1982 was {higher} than in 1985.

NC.Q: Was the total Food Cost Percentage in 1969 higher or lower than in 1970?
NC.A: The total food cost percentage in 1969 was {lower} than in 1970.

NC.Q: Between 1965 and 1972, did the total Food Cost Percentage experience a larger or smaller change than between 1973 and 1983?
NC.A: The change in total food cost percentage between 1965 and 1972 was {smaller} than between 1973 and 1983.

MSR.Q: Which series has the largest cumulative area in this area chart?
MSR.A: {Sky High Cafe} has the largest cumulative area.

VA.Q: To reduce the 'waving' visual effect in the area chart, reorder the layers by end value and list the labels from top to bottom after sorting.
VA.A: The reordered layer order from top to bottom is: {Emerald Diner, Crimson Plate, Stellar Bistro, Sky High Cafe, The Golden Spoon}.
